File libsrc/libgODBC/ODBCError.c

Routines for handling error messages. ODBCGetErrorMsg can be used after direct calls to libodbc routines (the SQL prefix) to get the libodbc error message.

ODBCSetErrorMsg is used mainly inside libgODBC to retrieve the libodbc error message, prefix a libgODBC message and store the message in a static location that will be returned by ODBCErrMsg.

ODBCErrMsg and ODBCErrno can be used after calls to libgODBC routines to retrieve the most recent error message and libodbc error number.

Public Function Index

ODBCErrMsg ()
Get a libgODBC error message.
ODBCErrno ()
Get a libgODBC error number.
ODBCGetErrorMsg (SQLSMALLINT, SQLHANDLE, char *)
Get the error message for the most recent libodbc library error.
ODBCSetErrorMsg (const char *, SQLSMALLINT, SQLHANDLE)
Set the ODBC error message that will be returned by ODBCErrMsg.

Public Functions

ODBCErrMsg 
 char *ODBCErrMsg()
Get a libgODBC error message.

Returns:
the most recent ODBC error message.
ODBCErrno 
 int ODBCErrno()
Get a libgODBC error number.

Returns:
the most recent ODBC error number.
ODBCGetErrorMsg 
 char *ODBCGetErrorMsg(SQLSMALLINT handleType,
                       SQLHANDLE handle,
                       char *error_msg)
Get the error message for the most recent libodbc library error.

Parameters:
handleType - the handle type of the second argument.
handle - the handle on which the error occurred.
error_msg - the message.
Returns:
error_msg pointer.
ODBCSetErrorMsg 
 char *ODBCSetErrorMsg(const char *header,
                       SQLSMALLINT handleType,
                       SQLHANDLE handle)
Set the ODBC error message that will be returned by ODBCErrMsg.

Parameters:
header - A text preface to the error message.
handleType - the handle type of the third argument.
handle - the handle on which the error occurred.
Returns:
the error message.
